result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonta Ramon Edwards

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 12 pages) commencing 10-06-2022 by Kaityln Edwards.

Defendant Devonta Ramon Edwards appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Devonta Ramon Edwards.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior OWI conviction. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Deputy Sheriff M. Szudarski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report-9-27-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Violation Report-9-20-2022
Defendant referred to Justice Point for level 3 supervision. Absolute sobriety, no use/possession of controlled substances.

Defendant Devonta Ramon Edwards in court. Attorney Amanda Poznanski with defendant Devonta Ramon Edwards. Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Court enters not guilty plea as to Misdemeanor Count 3. 
DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8/24/22 @ 1p
